intro: Tarenna patula, commonly known as the Madagascar starfruit, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its small, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are yellow when ripe, often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. Tarenna patula is typically found in humid, lowland forests and thrives in tropical climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
